name: Feedly Large Print Edition (works with Readly)
description:
I love Feedly, the beautiful front end for <strike><del>Google Reader</del></strike>* feed reader. However, my middle-aged eyes don't. The text size for entries and summaries is just too small, and the category labels are too low-contrast. I finally decided to do something about it.

So here's a very simple user style to make Feedly as comfortable to read for myopic infofreaks as it is stylish. It should be easy to tweak for your own needs.

*Why you gotta break my heart Google man?
additional_info: March 26, 2013 If you're switching to Feedly from Google Reader, but miss the Google Reader layout, be sure to grab Lockal's Readly Greasemonkey script. It gives you a classic Google Reader layout, full width, high contrast, plus I can confirm that it works with Feedly Large Print Edition. While I still like my classic Feedly tiles and lists for most feeds, Lockal's script almost makes me want to switch to it full time. Seriously fantastic work. September 6, 2012 Version 1.1 Changes: Increased font size of labels, feed titles, unread counts, and suggestions August 10, 2012 Version 1.0
